text: The Men's 100 metre backstroke competition at the 2019 World Championships was held on 22 and 23 July 2019.ScheduleStart list The defending champion was Xu Jiayu, and he successfully defended his title. Jiayu set a competition record in the semifinals by winning his semifinal in 52.17 seconds. ==Records== Prior to the competition, the existing world and championship records were as follows. The following new records were set during this competition. {| class="wikitable" style=text-align:center |- ! Date !! Event !! Name !! Nationality !! Time !! Record |- | 22 July || Semifinal || align=left|Xu Jiayu || align=left| || 52.17 || CR |} ==Results== ===Heats=== The heats were held on 22 July at 10:20.Heats results Due to backstroke wedge malfunctions, Simone Sabbioni and Dylan Carter swam alone in new series, after the end of the normal series, and both achieved classification. The swimmers who had obtained the vacancy, and would be disqualified after these 2 series (Thomas Ceccon and Richárd Bohus), received extra vacancies for the semifinal, that ended up being with 18 swimmers. {| class="wikitable sortable" style="text- align:center" |- !
